summary: Email chain between prosecutors and Akin Gump attorneys regarding scheduling a proffer session to review financial records related to Jeffrey Epstein's accounts at a bank. The attorneys plan to present an overview of Epstein's relationship with the bank, account types, and notable transactions.

persons.name: Parvin Moyne
persons.role: Attorney at Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP
persons.context: Primary correspondent from Akin Gump, coordinating the scheduling and format of a proffer session to guide prosecutors through financial records related to Jeffrey Epstein's bank accounts.

persons.name: Thomas Moyer
persons.context: Copied on the email chain, involved in the coordination of the proffer session regarding Epstein's financial records.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual whose relationship with a bank, accounts, and financial transactions are the subject of the proffer and document production being discussed.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at Akin Gump working together on the response to a subpoena and the coordination of a proffer regarding Jeffrey Epstein's financial records.
Parvin Moyne, representing a bank, is involved in presenting information about Epstein's financial relationship with that bank, implying a legal or investigative connection to Epstein's affairs.

events.title: Proposed proffer session
events.description: A proposed date for attorneys from Akin Gump to deliver a presentation to prosecutors overviewing Jeffrey Epstein's relationship with a bank, his accounts, and notable transactions.

events.title: Production index sent
events.description: Parvin Moyne sends an index of documents produced to date in response to a subpoena related to Jeffrey Epstein's financial records.

locations: One Bryant Park, New York, NY 10036-6745
keyFacts: Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP attorneys are coordinating with prosecutors to provide a proffer on Jeffrey Epstein's financial relationship with a bank.
The proffer aims to overview Epstein's accounts, transaction types, and highlight specific transactions noted in an internal investigation.
The document indicates an ongoing financial investigation into Epstein, with subpoena returns being reviewed by prosecutors.
Email participants discuss scheduling around travel and trials, with a focus on early September 2019 for the proffer session.
